subject: Law
title: The Insanity Defense
description: Learn The Insanity Defense in one minute.

hook.text: John Hinckley shot President Reagan in 1981. He was found not guilty by reason of insanity. The public was outraged.

buildup.text: The insanity defense argues the defendant lacked the mental capacity to understand their actions were wrong.

discovery.text: Under the M'Naghten rule, the defendant must prove they didn't know the nature of the act or that it was wrong.

twist.text: It's raised in less than 1% of cases and succeeds only about 25% of the time. It's rare, not a loophole.

climax.text: A successful insanity plea usually means commitment to a psychiatric facilityâ€”often longer than a prison sentence.

punchline.text: 'Not guilty' by insanity doesn't mean freedom. It means a different cage.
